h7401.definition: a primitive root; to soften (intransitively or transitively), used figuratively; (be) faint(-hearted), mollify, (be, make) soft(-er), be tender.

h7402.definition: a primitive root; to travel for trading; (spice) merchant.

h7403.definition: from {{h7402}}; merchant; Rakal, a place in Palestine; Rachal.

h7404.definition: feminine passive participle of {{h7402}}; trade (as peddled); merchandise, traffic.

h7405.definition: a primitive root; to tie; bind.

h7406.definition: from {{h7405}}; a mountain ridge (as of tied summits); rough place.

h7407.definition: from {{h7405}}; a snare (as of tied meshes); pride.

h7408.definition: a primitive root; to lay up, i.e. collect; gather, get.

h7409.definition: from {{h7408}}; a relay of animals on a post-route (as stored up for that purpose); by implication, a courser; dromedary, mule, swift beast.

h7410.definition: active participle of {{h7311}}; high; Ram, the name of an Arabian and of an Israelite; Ram. See also {{h1027}}.

h7411.definition: a primitive root; to hurl; specifically, to shoot; figuratively, to delude or betray (as if causing to fall); beguile, betray, (bow-) man, carry, deceive, throw.

h7412.definition: (Aramaic) corresponding to {{h7411}}; to throw, set, (figuratively) assess; cast (down), impose.

h7413.definition: feminine active participle of {{h7311}}; a height (as a seat of idolatry); high place.

h7414.definition: the same as {{h7413}}; Ramah, the name of four places in Palestine; Ramah.

h7415.definition: from {{h7426}} in the sense of breeding (compare {{h7311}}); a maggot (as rapidly bred), literally or figuratively; worm.

h7416.definition: or רִמֹּן; from {{h7426}}; a pomegranate, the tree (from its upright growth) or the fruit (also an artificial ornament); pomegranate.

h7417.definition: or (shorter) (רִמֹּן; or רִמּוֹנוֹ; (1 Chronicles 6:62 ({{h77}})), the same as {{h7416}}; in Joshua 19:13: הַמְּתֹאָר is mistaken for part of a name; article with the passive participle of {{h8388}}; the (one) marked off, i.e. which pertains).; Rimmon, the name of a Syrian deity, also of five places in Palestine; Remmon, Rimmon.

h7418.definition: or רָמַת נֶגֶב; from the plural or construct form of {{h7413}} and {{h5045}}; heights (or height) of the South; Ramoth-Negeb or Ramath-Negeb, a place in Palestine; south Ramoth, Ramath of the south.

h7420.definition: from an unused root meaning to hurl; a lance (as thrown); especially the iron point; buckler, javelin, lancet, spear.

h7421.definition: for {{h761}}; a Ramite, i.e. Aramaean; Syrian.

h7422.definition: from {{h7311}} and {{h3050}}; Jah has raised; Ramjah, an Israelite; Ramiah.

h7423.definition: from {{h7411}}; remissness, treachery; deceit(-ful, -fully), false, guile, idle, slack, slothful.

h7424.definition: of foreign origin; a brood mare; dromedary.

h7425.definition: from an unused root and {{h3050}} (perhaps meaning to deck); Jah has bedecked; Remaljah, an Israelite; Remaliah.

h7426.definition: a primitive root; to rise (literally or figuratively); exalt, get (oneself) up, lift up (self), mount up.

h7427.definition: from the active participle of {{h7426}}; exaltation; lifting up of self.

h7428.definition: from {{h7416}} and {{h6556}}; pomegranate of the breach; Rimmon-Perets, a place in the Desert; Rimmon-parez.

h7429.definition: a primitive root; to tread upon (as a potter, in walking or abusively); oppressor, stamp upon, trample (under feet), tread (down, upon).

h7430.definition: a primitive root; properly, to glide swiftly, i.e. to crawl or move with short steps; by analogy to swarm; creep, move.

h7431.definition: from {{h7430}}; a reptile or any other rapidly moving animal; that creepeth, creeping (moving) thing.

h7432.definition: from {{h7411}}; height; Remeth, a place in Palestine; Remeth.

h7433.definition: or רָמוֹת גִּלעָד; (2 Chronicles 22:5), from the plural of {{h7413}} and {{h1568}}; heights of Gilad; Ramoth-Gilad, a place East of the Jordan; Ramoth-gilead, Ramoth in Gilead. See also {{h7216}}.

h7434.definition: from {{h7413}} and {{h4707}} with the article interpolated; height of the watch-tower; Ramath-ham-Mitspeh, a place in Palestine; Ramath-mizpeh.

h7435.definition: patronymic of {{h7414}}; a Ramathite or inhabitant of Ramah; Ramathite.

h7436.definition: from the dual of {{h7413}} and the plural of the active participle of {{h6822}}; double height of watchers; Ramathajim-Tsophim, a place in Palestine; Ramathaimzophim.

h7437.definition: from {{h7413}} and {{h3895}}; height of a jaw-bone; Ramath-Lechi, a place in Palestine; Ramath-lehi.

h7439.definition: a primitive root; to whiz; rattle.

h7440.definition: from {{h7442}}; properly, a creaking (or shrill sound), i.e. shout (of joy or grief); cry, gladness, joy, proclamation, rejoicing, shouting, sing(-ing), triumph.

h7441.definition: the same as {{h7440}}; Rinnah, an Israelite; Rinnah.

h7442.definition: a primitive root; properly, to creak (or emit a stridulous sound), i.e. to shout (usually for joy); aloud for joy, cry out, be joyful (greatly, make to) rejoice, (cause to) shout (for joy), (cause to) sing (aloud, for joy, out), triumph.

h7443.definition: from {{h7442}}; an ostrich (from its wail); × goodly.

h7445.definition: from {{h7442}}; a shout (for joy); joyful (voice), singing, triumphing.

h7446.definition: from {{h7450}}; a ruin (as dripping to pieces); Rissah, a place in the Desert; Rissah.

h7447.definition: from {{h7450}}; properly, dripping to pieces, i.e. a ruin; also a dew-drop; breach, drop.

h7448.definition: from an unused root meaning to curb; a halter (as restraining); by implication, the jaw; bridle.

h7449.definition: the same as {{h7448}}; Resen, a place in Assyrian; Resen.

h7450.definition: a primitive root; to comminute; used only as denominative from {{h7447}},; to moisten (with drops); temper.

h7451.definition: from {{h7489}}; bad or (as noun) evil (natural or moral); adversity, affliction, bad, calamity,   displease(-ure), distress, evil((-favouredness), man, thing),   exceedingly, × great, grief(-vous), harm, heavy, hurt(-ful), ill (favoured),   mark, mischief(-vous), misery, naught(-ty), noisome,   not please, sad(-ly), sore, sorrow, trouble, vex, wicked(-ly, -ness, one), worse(-st), wretchedness, wrong. (Incl. feminine raaah; as adjective or noun.).

h7452.definition: from {{h7321}}; a crash (of thunder), noise (of war), shout (of joy); × aloud, noise, shouted.

h7453.definition: or רֵיעַ; from {{h7462}}; an associate (more or less close); brother, companion, fellow, friend, husband, lover, neighbour, × (an-) other.

h7454.definition: from {{h7462}}; a thought (as association of ideas); thought.

h7455.definition: from {{h7489}}; badness (as marring), physically or morally; × be so bad, badness, (× be so) evil, naughtiness, sadness, sorrow, wickedness.

h7456.definition: a primitive root; to hunger; (suffer to) famish, (be, have, suffer, suffer to) hunger(-ry).

h7457.definition: from {{h7456}}; hungry (more or less intensely); hunger bitten, hungry.

h7458.definition: from {{h7456}}; hunger (more or less extensive); dearth, famine,   famished, hunger.

h7460.definition: a primitive root; to shudder (more or less violently); tremble.

h7461.definition: or (feminine) רְעָדָהxlit rᵉâdâh corrected to rᵉʻâdâh; from {{h7460}}; a shudder; trembling.

h7462.definition: a primitive root; to tend a flock; i.e. pasture it; intransitively, to graze (literally or figuratively); generally to rule; by extension, to associate with (as a friend); × break, companion, keep company with, devour, eat up, evil entreat, feed, use as a friend, make friendship with, herdman, keep (sheep) (-er), pastor,   shearing house, shepherd, wander, waste.

h7464.definition: feminine of {{h7453}}; a female associate; companion, fellow.

h7466.definition: for {{h7471}} in the sense of {{h7453}}; friend; Reu, a postdiluvian patriarch; Reu.

h7467.definition: from the same as {{h7466}} and {{h410}}; friend of God; Reuel, the name of Moses' father-in-law, also of an Edomite and an Israelite; Raguel, Reuel.

h7468.definition: from {{h7462}} in the sense of {{h7453}}; a female associate; generally an additional one; another, mate, neighbour.

h7469.definition: probably from {{h7462}}; a feeding upon, i.e. grasping after; vexation.

h7472.definition: from {{h7453}}; social; Rei, an Israelite; Rei.

h7473.definition: from active participle of {{h7462}}; pastoral; as noun, a shepherd; shipherd.

h7474.definition: feminine of {{h7453}}; a female associate; fellow, love.

h7475.definition: from {{h7462}} in the sense of {{h7469}}; desire; vexation.

h7476.definition: (Aramaic) corresponding to {{h7475}}; a grasp. i.e. (figuratively) mental conception; cogitation, thought.

h7477.definition: a primitive root; to reel, i.e. (figuratively) to brandish; terribly shake.

h7479.definition: feminine of {{h7478}}; a long veil (as fluttering); muffler.

h7480.definition: from {{h7477}} and {{h3050}}; made to tremble (i.e. fearful) of Jah; Reelajah, an Israelite; Reeliah.

h7481.definition: a primitive root; to tumble, i.e. be violently agitated; specifically, to crash (of thunder); figuratively, to irritate (with anger); make to fret, roar, thunder, trouble.

h7482.definition: from {{h7481}}; a peal of thunder; thunder.

h7483.definition: feminine of {{h7482}}; the mane of a horse (as quivering in the wind); thunder.

h7484.definition: the same as {{h7483}}; Ramah, the name of a grandson of Ham, and of a place (perhaps founded by him); Raamah.

h7485.definition: from {{h7481}} and {{h3050}}; Jah has shaken; Raamjah, an Israelite; Raamiah.

h7486.definition: or רַעַמְסֵס; of Egyptian origin; Rameses or Raamses, a place in Egypt; Raamses, Rameses.

h7487.definition: (Aramaic) corresponding to {{h7488}}; green, i.e. (figuratively) prosperous; flourishing.

h7488.definition: from an unused root meaning to be green; verdant; by analogy, new; figuratively, prosperous; green, flourishing.

h7489.definition: a primitive root; properly, to spoil (literally, by breaking to pieces); figuratively, to make (or be) good for nothing, i.e. bad (physically, socially or morally); afflict, associate selves (by mistake for {{h7462}}), break (down, in pieces),   displease, (be, bring, do) evil (doer, entreat, man), show self friendly (by mistake for {{h7462}}), do harm, (do) hurt, (behave self, deal) ill, × indeed, do mischief, punish, still, vex, (do) wicked (doer, -ly), be (deal, do) worse.

h7491.definition: a primitive root; to drip; distil, drop (down).

h7492.definition: a primitive root; to break in pieces; figuratively, harass; dash in pieces, vex.

h7493.definition: a primitive root; to undulate (as the earth, the sky, etc.; also a field of grain), particularly through fear; specifically, to spring (as a locust); make afraid, (re-) move, quake, (make to) shake, (make to) tremble.

h7494.definition: from {{h7493}}; vibration, bounding, uproar; commotion, confused noise, earthquake, fierceness, quaking, rattling, rushing, shaking.

h7495.definition: or רָפָה; a primitive root; properly, to mend (by stitching), i.e. (figuratively) to cure; cure, (cause to) heal, physician, repair, × thoroughly, make whole. See {{h7503}}.

h7496.definition: from {{h7495}} in the sense of {{h7503}}; properly, lax, i.e. (figuratively) a ghost (as dead; in plural only); dead, deceased.

h7497.definition: or רָפָה; from {{h7495}} in the sense of invigorating; a giant; giant, Rapha, Rephaim(-s). See also {{h1051}}.

h7498.definition: or רָפָה; probably the same as {{h7497}}; giant; Rapha or Raphah, the name of two Israelites; Rapha.

h7499.definition: feminine passive participle of {{h7495}}; a medicament; heal(-ed), medicine.
